Posted By: DonRoyale (2/19/2010 11:56:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I don't agree with the low rating but like all the winner cards for Kor with exception of the Devout Lightcaster or Kor Firewalker this little nasty usually faces the wrong end of a bolt or deathmark quick. Other than that, it works so well with Kor/Equipment. I would say the best way to protect her if you is to bring out a fast flyer from Kor as a Bolt Magnet. Most decks don't have early flyers and they will eat the bolts reducing the chance of losing her as she drops. Now if you can get a Whispersilk Cloak or Magebane Armor on her fast then you are golden.

@buddy2

Seriously, have you not played standard in that era besides using caw blade? do you know how ridiculous it was? posts.post_content:
@ buddy2  
  
a 2-drop that attracts removal is a problem. Plus even if you remove it, it already tutored for an equipment. even tarmogoyf and dark confidant do nothing if you immediately kill them (then again, they do way more than stoneforge the longer they stay alive).  
  
I agree that it's fine in legacy, but it was way too powerful in standard, and unbanning it in modern is questionable; jitte and the 5 swords still exist. steelshaper's gift is a completely playable card in modern, and stoneforge is (almost) strictly better.

posts.post_content:
To all the people who complain about this card:   
  
There's something called "removal", maybe you've heard of it? If not, then don't expect to win any games anyway. Seriously, if you don't play [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), [Smother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smother), or [Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember), among many other options, then your deck is either very bad or a combo deck that doesn't care what its opponent does. If your deck is very bad, then YOUR DECK IS VERY BAD. It isn't going to win anyway. If you're playing a combo deck, then you should be much more worried about their Force of Will than their Stoneforge. Let them have a [Batterskull](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Batterskull), you are just going to hit them for 30 with a [Tendrils of Agony](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tendrils of Agony) or make them draw 60 cards with a [Blue Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blue Sun's Zenith).  
  
In addition to removal, there is also [Spell Snare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spell Snare), [Thoughtseize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thoughtseize), [Inquisitio](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisitio)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
@buddy2  
  
Dude you're an idiot. Being someone who has some experience using her as well as Elbrus, let me tell you EXACTLY how scary she gets.  
  
It doesn't matter what the hell happens to her after she's been dropped. Tutoring is all she's needed for as she's usually tutoring is a sword that can be dropped the turn after. If I don't think she'll be killed immediately, I'll tutor Batterskull or Elbrus so I can cheat it out next turn. By turn 3, I can drop and equip Elbrus on a Birds of Paradise and hit you for the transformation, or drop a Batterskull and have a 4/4 vigilance lifelink beatstick that, by experience, ALWAYS eats up the removal before Stoneforge Mystic does. She dies? I'm OVERJOYED because I can trigger the EtB again with Sun Titan in a couple turns and tutor more things out.  
  
Wanna kill Elbrus' Transformation? [Karakas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karakas) the creature and re-drop Elbrus and try again. Swords to Plowshares in response to gain 13+ life.  
  
Besides, if she DOES die before she dr... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
